intro: Pedicularis forrestiana, commonly known as the Chinese monkeyflower, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a distinctive hooded shape. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a notable species in botanical studies and horticulture.
